end of the continuum the the

mean how could you build an animal like
that and have it survive and thrive and
actually function or persists as a

that screwed up in that crazy so it's
some level we're interested in them
because we're interested in diversity
and these are some of the extremes of

structures the weapons in these beetles
so the concepts in the in the backdrop
the behavior in the meeting system is
generalizable but we're also learning

to look at how nutrition influences the

it is that high nutrition translates
into a really big weapon and so the real
benefit to the big weapons is those
males guard the key real estate and
because they have the key real estate
they mate with the most females in the
populations but there's definitely
evidence that big males are more likely
to win fights and among size match males
the males with the largest horns are the
most likely to win fights but just like
we see in the field in our battle box
the males are fighting over food sources
and fighting over females and they use
their horn to like flick off the
opponent and try and get them away but
in the battle box the the loser doesn't
really go away very far so keep fighting
so so these are weapons they're used by

analogous in every
back to antlers that you'd see in deer

can't study with I mean it's very hard
to do a genetic breeding experiment on

over time through the process of
